0 air_temp -  The degree of hotness or coldness measured against a definite scale, in this case for the atmosphere. K K K 
currentoperationalair temperature temperatureAir    
0 max_air_temp -  The greatest air temperature in a given period of time. K K K 
currentdeprecatedmaximum air temperature temperatureMaximum 2 11 1 
0 min_air_temp -  The lowest air temperature in a given period of time. K K K

0 air_temp_ens_stdev -  The standard deviation of the air temperature of the ensemble members for a point in time. K  none 
currentoperationalair temperature ensemble standard deviation none 253   
1 virt_air_temp -  Temperature that dry air would have if its pressure and density were equal to those of a given sample of moist air. K K K 
listedoperationalvirtual air temperature temperatureVirtual    
2 ptnl_temp -  The temperature an unsaturated parcel of dry air would have if brought adiabatically and reversibly from its initial state to a standard pressure. K  K 
listedoperationalpotential temperature temperaturePotential    
3 eq_ptnl_temp -  A thermodynamic quantity, with its natural logarithm proportional to the entropy of moist air, that is conserved in a reversible moist adiabatic process. (AMS Glossary) K  K 
listedoperationalequivalent potential temperature none    
6 dwpt_temp -  The temperature to which a given parcel of air must be cooled at constant pressure and water vapor content in order for saturation to occur. K K K 
listedoperationaldewpoint temperature temperatureDewpoint    
7 dwpt_dprs -  The quantity of difference between the air temperature and the dewpoint temperature. K K K 
currentoperationaldewpoint depression temperatureDewpointDepression    
8 temp_lapse_rate -  The decrease of atmospheric temperature with height. deg_K/m deg_K/m deg_K/m

9 temp_anom -  The deviation of temperature in a given region over a specified period from the long-term average value for the same region (AMS Glossary). K K K 
listedoperationaltemperature anomaly temperatureAnomaly    
10 ltnt_heat_flux -  The estimated rate of heat flow per unit mass for a system in a reversible, isobaric-isotheric change of phase. W/m2 W/m2 none

11 snsb_heat_flux -  The estimated rate of the flow of heat between two bodies. W/m2  W/m2

248 grnd_sea_temp -  The temperature at the surface of the ocean and/or land; specifically a bulk temperature of the top layer of the ocean model or the upper most layer of the land model. K K K

Footnotes:

  1. The Parameter Number comes from the GRIB 2 Table 4.2 series
  2. The FNMOC Identifier is the same as the name
  3. The Status may be one of the following:
    4. valuedefinition
    availableEntry was used in the past, is not in production now, and could be used again.
    currentEntry is currently in production and available to customers.
    deprecatedEntry is no longer to be used. May or may not be in production.
    listedEntry is listed in WMO documentation. Not in production with no plans to be produced.
    obsoleteEntry is not to be used and is not in production, if it ever was.
    pendingEntry is being prepared for production.
    plannedEntry is being looked at for possible production.
  4. The WMO Status may be one of the following:
    5. valuedefinition
    deprecatedEntry is no longer used.
    experimentalEntry is not recommended for use outside of bi-lateral previously agreed tests.
    operationalEntry is available for use.
    validationEntry is in the approval process.
  5. The Joint METOC Brokerage Language (JMBL) identifier
  6. The Statistical number comes from the GRIB 2 Table 4.10
  7. The Unit of Time Range comes from the GRIB 2 Table 4.4
  8. The Length of Time is multiplied by the Unit of Time Range
  9. The parameter numbers 4, 5, 14 are deprecated. Use another parameter.
